overall_description: A refined 18k yellow gold ring featuring a partial eternity arrangement of four round-cut green gemstones (emeralds or tsavorites) held in a shared-prong setting. The ring features a polished D-profile shank with a personalized engraving 'adhav' on the interior.

image_generation_prompt.main_prompt: A high-quality 3D reference image of an empty gold ring mounting without gemstones. The object is made of 18k yellow gold with a highly polished mirror finish. The design features a continuous band that transitions into a setting head at the top. The setting area consists of four circular stone seats arranged in a row. Vertical prong structures rise between the seats to form a shared-prong mechanism. The side profile of the gallery features U-shaped cutouts beneath each stone seat position to allow light entry. The shank profile is rounded (D-shape) and smooth. The interior of the band is smooth and cylindrical. 3/4 view angle to show both the side profile and the top cavities for the stones.
image_generation_prompt.style_modifiers: Product photography, macro lens, studio lighting, softbox reflections, 3/4 perspective view, neutral mid-gray solid background (#808080), clean professional render, high resolution, sharp metallic details, gold material shader, no shadows on background
image_generation_prompt.negative_prompt: gemstones, diamonds, emeralds, filled settings, transparent background, white background, black background, noise, blurry, distorted geometry, scratches, rough texture
image_generation_prompt.camera_angle: 3/4 perspective view looking slightly down at the empty stone seats
image_generation_prompt.lighting_description: Soft studio lighting with rim lights to highlight the gold edges and prong tips

components.shape_description: Torus-based ring shank transitioning into a linear multi-seat bezel structure
components.manufacturing_notes: Produced via lost-wax casting. The mounting is cast as a single piece, then polished. Stone seats are burred to size before setting.

image_generation_prompt.main_prompt: A single isolated round brilliant-cut emerald gemstone. The material is a vivid, deep forest green crystal with high transparency and vitreous luster. The object features standard brilliant faceting: a flat top table, angled crown facets, a thin girdle, and a conical pavilion terminating in a culet. The stone exhibits internal light refraction and sharp, crisp facet edges. The surface is highly reflective and glass-like. The color is rich and saturated green, typical of high-quality emerald or tsavorite.
image_generation_prompt.style_modifiers: Macro product photography, gemology style, sharp focus, caustic lighting effects, 3/4 perspective view, neutral mid-gray solid background (#808080), high resolution, ray-traced look
image_generation_prompt.negative_prompt: metal, ring, setting, jewelry, opaque, inclusion, cracked, dull, white background, black background, multiple stones
image_generation_prompt.camera_angle: Isometric view showing crown and pavilion depth
image_generation_prompt.lighting_description: Bright focused lighting to generate caustics and highlight internal facets

components.position: Set into the top gallery of the mounting
components.manufacturing_notes: Precision cut stone. Set into the mounting by notching the prongs and bending them over the stone's girdle.

additional_notes: The shared-prong setting requires precise spacing in the casting (Component 1) to ensure the stones (Component 2) fit snugly touching each other without overlapping. The engraving 'adhav' is a post-processing step likely done with laser engraving.
